Course Description

This course provides an introduction to different approaches to research in the information sciences, including social science methods, data and text mining, digital humanities, medicine, and others. Topics include methods for evaluating research, developing research questions, selecting research methods, conducting research ethically, and communicating findings clearly and effectively through words, graphics, and other visualizations.
